sentence.text: Transcription nucleosome disassemblyors (TFs) are major cell fate regulators frequently involved in cancer, particularly in leukemia.
In humans, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutations are associated with severe congenital neutropenia.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In keeping with this key role in cell negative regulation of apoptotic process, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II is emerging as a gene involved in cancer, which also includes solid tumors.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In nucleosome disassembly, abnormal activation of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II has been related to human medulloblastoma and is also likely to be relevant in blood malignancies.
